channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Republican rep indicates he will be 'a no' on Trump-backed rescissions measure if AIDS relief cut
item.description: Republican Rep. Don Bacon told the New York Times that he has has indicated he's "a no" on the rescissions measure Trump wants Congress to pass.

item.title: Amazon’s MGM is reportedly making a film about Sam Altman being kicked out of OpenAI
item.description: Artificial has yet to be cast, but big names are circling.

item.title: America Loses If Russia Wins
item.description: If America relinquishes its leadership of the free world, our economy, our security, and our future will be in peril.

item.title: GOP leadership unleashes fury on Dem governor ahead of blockbuster congressional hearing
item.description: GOP Whip Tom Emmer slammed Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz ahead of a major committee hearing set to take place this week.

item.title: Predatory Pricing Is More Myth Than Market Threat
item.description: Basic economic ideas explain why most alleged cases of predatory pricing represent something else entirely.

item.title: How Republicans Can Make the Tax Bill More Pro-Growth
item.description: They should insist on making full expensing for capital investment permanent for all businesses.

item.title: Exclusive: Coinbase vets raise $30 million for crypto wallet startup Turnkey
item.description: The fundraise attracted big VC names like Bain Capital Crypto, Sequoia Capital and Lightspeed Faction.

item.title: Milan Kovac ran Elon Musk’s most important project: What the departure of the Optimus head means for Tesla
item.description: “This one hits different. You’re in the Tesla hall of fame, brother,” wrote one senior Tesla manager.

item.title: Is Nikole Hannah-Jones’s 1619 Project Grift Drying Up?
item.description: The gigs that funded Hannah-Jones' lavish lifestyle seem to be fewer in number and flatlining as Americans see through the Critical Race Theory scam.

item.title: 'Homeland would've been stolen': AK Natives sound off on Biden energy bans as Trump officials tour tundra
item.description: Kaktovik, Alaska, resident thanks president for blocking environmental groups while Energy Secretary Chris Wright highlights untapped potential.

item.title: As more customers default on BNPL loans, Klarna’s CEO predicts AI will cause a recession
item.description: Sebastian Siemiatkowski foresees mass AI-induced headcount reductions among white collar workers.

item.title: Never Stop Loving America
item.description: It’s a mess, but a blessed one.

item.title: A Brief Guide To Using ‘Recissions’ And ‘Pocket Recissions’ To Cut Federal Spending
item.description: The Trump rescissions package should provide an opportunity to begin to reduce the continued, disastrous growth of the federal budget.

item.title: To Execute The Trump Agenda, DOJ’s Civil Rights Division Cannot Be Stuck Understaffed

item.description: President Donald Trump's new travel ban began restricting entry for citizens from 12 nations while imposing heightened restrictions on seven others Mo...

item.title: Trump's spending bill heads to Senate where Republicans plan strategic adjustments to key provisions

item.title: How Studying The Greatest Speeches In American History Can Change You (And Your Children) Forever
item.description: We simply started with the words. For the foundation of all learning, all communication, and all thought, is words.

item.title: In Attempt To Insult Top Women’s Sports Defender, Simone Biles Confirms Difference In The Sexes
item.description: Biles’ public ‘female-only sport for me but not for thee’ approach to the issue is not only hypocritical, but incredibly unpopular.

item.title: SINKs need to earn at least $81,000 to live comfortably in America’s cheapest state—the most expensive require an $120,000 salary
item.description: Hawaii is the state where single adults need to earn the most to feel financially comfortable, while West Virginia is the most affordable.

item.title: Judge allows Trump's firings at Corporation for Public Broadcasting
item.description: A federal judge on Sunday shot down a demand for reinstatement by three members of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting whom President Trump fired ...

item.description: Top Trump officials had been warning for weeks that Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the Salvadoran illegal migrant that Democrats turned into a deportation mart...

item.title: After tear gas and street fires, a Los Angeles community cleans up as National Guard troops arrive

item.title: ABC correspondent suspended after bashing Trump, Miller as 'world-class' haters
item.description: ABC News correspondent Terry Moran has been suspended after attacking top Trump aide Stephen Miller as "richly endowed with the capacity for hatred."

item.title: Mike Johnson downplays Musk's influence and says Republicans will pass Trump's tax and budget bill
item.description: With an uncharacteristic feistiness, Speaker Mike Johnson took clear sides Sunday in President Donald Trump's breakup with mega-billionaire Elon Musk.

item.title: Pete Buttigieg Doesn’t Have a Time Machine
item.description: It means little that he can half-heartedly break from aspects of the Democratic Party’s record that he now realizes are controversial.

item.title: Private Credit’s Surge Has Investors Excited and Regulators Concerned
item.description: Private credit's accelerated growth raises critical questions about liquidity, transparency, and systemic risk.

item.title: Currency Coordination Looks Riskier Today
item.description: This post examines the potential consequences of coordinated dollar depreciation today -- from FX volatility and insurance risk to broader macroeconom...

item.title: Maladapted Industries: The Risk of Artificial Selection by the State
item.description: From Europe’s steelmakers to global EV producers, "pet industries" rely on state support to survive, but as political winds shift, their future looks ...

item.title: Think We’ve Seen the Last +1,000-BPS High Yield Spread? Think Again
item.description: Think +1,000-bps high yield spreads are history? Marty Fridson shows why they could still hit that mark in the next recession.

item.title: Tariffs, Inflation, and Returns: How Investments Respond to Supply Shocks
item.description: Learn how tariff-related inflation shocks ripple through markets—and which assets have historically helped investors navigate the turbulence.
